description_txt: stated on December 9, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: "Rhode Island is the only state where officers at state-supported [colleges] carry out their duties unarmed."

description_txt: stated on February 9, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: "Between 1982 and 2007 the cost of a college education increased 439 percent."

description_txt: stated on February 29, 2012 in a campaign speech:
quote_txt: "When my grandfather came to this country back in 1925, there were no government benefits."

description_txt: stated on February 27, 2012 in a Web ad:
quote_txt: Connie Mack's "only real job in the real world" was as "‘events coordinator’ for Hooters!"

description_txt: stated on January 24, 2012 in a news article:
quote_txt: The Atlanta area’s water planning district "is now the national leader in conservation."

description_txt: stated on February 13, 2012 in a town hall-style meeting:
quote_txt: "The top 1 percent (of income earners) paid 36.7 percent (of the taxes).  ... The top 50 percent pay 97.7 percent."

description_txt: stated on March 2, 2012 in a rally in Cleveland, Ohio:
quote_txt: Says in the 2012 State of the Union address, President Obama "didn't even mention the deficit or debt."

description_txt: stated on February 23, 2012 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: Wisconsin is called the Badger State because "our ancestors came here with the hopes of living the American dream by mining."

description_txt: stated on February 28, 2012 in an interview on NJToday:
quote_txt: Says State Comptroller Matthew Boxer "pointed out that many towns are artificially lowering the real estate values that they report to Trenton" in order to "get hundreds of millions of dollars of additional school aid. This is the kind of fraud that needs to be addressed immediately."

description_txt: stated on February 15, 2012 in a speech:
quote_txt: "[E]mployment in Gwinnett is up more than 3 percent over last year, and unemployment is the lowest of the five core metro counties."

description_txt: stated on February 24, 2012 in a symposium.:
quote_txt: President Obama's "budget would call for about $25 trillion in debt by the end of his term, if he was re-elected."

description_txt: stated on February 22, 2012 in a press release.:
quote_txt: Says Ted Cruz slurred Republican senators including John Cornyn as "graybeards" and "spineless jellyfish."

description_txt: stated on February 20, 2012 in a campaign commercial:
quote_txt: "When (Marcy) Kaptur fought for the Democrats' prescription drug benefit for seniors, (Dennis) Kucinich voted no."

description_txt: stated on March 1, 2012 in a press release:
quote_txt: Pasco County "opened 22 new schools over six years to keep pace with growth in student population and implement the class size amendment."

description_txt: stated on January 6, 2012 in a press release:
quote_txt: Pasco County schools have graduation rates "substantially higher than the state average" and dropout rates "below the state average."

description_txt: stated on February 21, 2012 in a legislative floor speech:
quote_txt: While fighting a move to toughen penalties for workplace gender discrimination, state Sen. Glenn Grothman said "he didn’t believe women belonged in the workplace" but belonged "at home, cooking and cleaning and having babies."

description_txt: stated on February 21, 2012 in an interview on CNN’s “Piers Morgan Tonight”:
quote_txt: Says "we had to cut 13 billion dollars in state spending over two years."

description_txt: stated on January 30, 2012 in his State of the State address.:
quote_txt: "In 2011, there were more than 28,000 new Tennessee jobs created and over $4 billion in capital investment. Our Jobs4TN plan is working."

description_txt: stated on February 24, 2012 in "an appearance on A Lively Experiment.":
quote_txt: "One out of four of our young people say they are victims of this (dating) violence."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • March 4, 2012

description_txt: stated on February 19, 2012 in a speech:
quote_txt: "[R]emember, the president proposed eliminating charitable deductions for higher-income taxpayers."

description_txt: stated on February 24, 2012 in a Senate floor speech:
quote_txt: "In 2010 about 75 percent of child abuse and neglect reports in Oregon were made by those required to report by law."

name_txt: American Civil Liberties Union of Florida
description_txt: stated on March 1, 2012 in interview on "The Colbert Report":
quote_txt: There are "a larger number of shark attacks in Florida than there are cases of voter fraud."

quote_txt: "In some communities, for $10,000 worth of (PIP) coverage it’s $1,500 a year."
